title: Sun opposition Venus
summary: Identity and connection pull against each other. Personal goals or visibility may compete with the desire to keep harmony. The opportunity is to negotiate values rather than choosing between self and relationship.

meaning.headline: Self-expression and relating stand across the table, asking for balance.

frames.text: Sun–Venus oppositions surface tension between pursuing personal aims and maintaining ease with others.
It highlights where pleasing people might conflict with staying true to priorities.
Attention may swing between showcasing yourself and making space for someone else.
Negotiation becomes easier when values—not approval—lead the conversation.
This guarantees relationship drama or rejection.

frictions: Feeling unseen when others get attention
Projecting insecurity onto partners or friends
opportunities: Clarifying shared values before making plans
Refreshing aesthetics or routines to reflect current priorities

do: State what matters to you before negotiating.
Listen for the value beneath someone’s ask.
Acknowledge any envy or insecurity without acting from it.
Let appreciation be specific and grounded.
avoid: Competing for spotlight without naming why
Promising more than you can maintain

reusable_lines.text: Balance what you value with what you share—both deserve airtime.
You can stay warm without giving yourself away.

forbidden_claims: Moralizing choices around pleasure or affection
allowed_framing: Possibility language: can highlight trade-offs, can clarify desires
Agency-forward framing: you choose how to negotiate needs
Contextual framing: conversations about values may feel louder today
